channel.title: Linux Users
channel.description:
If you are a Linux user, please post here what distro. you use, how it runs, and you're specific computer.
Fedora Linux Presario C500 Runs much better then Vista, gaming is not really it's strong point anyway so Wine will run pretty much anything you normally would, just faster.

item.title: Linux Users
item.dc:creator: kjhank
item.description:
openSUSE 11.2 on a Dell Inspiron 1521 (Turion X2 1.6, 2GiB RAM, Radeon X1200 (RS690), with KDE 4.4.2 (factory).
Gentoo on my desktop (Athlon64 3400+, 1GiB RAM, GF7900), triple-booting with Windows 2008 Server and Win7 (which iHave to reinstall, because I’ve still got the release candidate and iDon’t think it’s working anymore).

Read full topic

item.description:
Ubuntu 9.10 (Karmic Koala) runs extremely well on a P4 2.66GHz, 1GB RAM, NVidia GeForce4… and actually boots faster than any computer I’ve had.

item.title: Linux Users
item.dc:creator: TicTacToe
item.description:
Give TinyMe a shot. It’s meant as more of a full-time distro than Puppy or DSL and should run well on your hardware. It’s currently in beta, but it works very well from my experience.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux Users
item.dc:creator: wheybags
item.description:
I know, puppy and DSL are the only two distros I’ve got working, but I really hate both of them (Actually, I rather like DSL, but as a recovery tool, not as a primary OS).

Read full topic

item.title: Linux Users
item.dc:creator: wheybags
item.description:
Speaking of which, I need a distro recommendation. I install DSL on a SHITTY SHITTY laptop that I acquired for a tenner and a battered sausage, but GOD DAMN FLUXBOX IS CONFUSING, so I’m looking for an extremely lightweight ubuntu-based distro, so’s I’ll get the UI.

Note: I have acquired a total of 5 shitty computers over the last while, and am beginning to feel like sersoft.

Read full topic
